g.text: Hydrothermal process proposed by Sloop (according to [218]).
Iodide relithiation process proposed by Ganter et al. (according to [217]).
Electrochemical relithiation has been studied by several authors [219â€“221]. Ra et al. proposed an
electrochemical dissolution/deposition process for LCO batteries. This process, illustrated in Figure
20, involved the application of a small galvanostatic current (1 mA/cm
) in an aqueous slurry of spent
LCO powder with 4 M LiOH and KOH at a temperature of 40â€“100 Â°C. During the process,
, which migrated towards the platinum working electrode (anode). Both Co
